upplemented with 5% fetal calf serum (FCS) , 100 units/ml penicillin, 100 μg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L- glutamine and 50 μM 3-mercaptoethanol to 6.66 x 106 cells/ml. The thymocytes were plated into 96-well microtiter plates at 106 cells/well (150 μl) . The cells were activated with 1.0 μg/ml of phytohemagglutinin and 8 units/ml of interleukin-1 (IL-1) (Boehringer Mannheim, Indianapolis, IN) . 0.02 to 200 pmol of the peptides or 0.02 to 50 fmol of TGF-/82 were added and the total volume was adjusted to 250 μl with the culture medium. The cells were incubated at 37°C for 72 hr in a humidified incubator in 5% C02-95% air atmosphere. The cells were pulsed with 0.5 μCi/well of 3H-thymidine 24 hours prior to cell harvest. The thymocytes were harvested onto glass fiber filters and dried. The amount of 3H- thymidine incorporation was determined by liquid scintillation counting method.

The results obtained indicated that TGF-/82 inhibited incorporation of 3H-thymidine into the DNA of murine thymocytes with an ED50 of approximately 4 pM. The TGF-/3216_47 dimer was also active as an inhibitor of thymocyte proliferation in this assay with an ED50 of 57 nM. However, both TGF-3l16_31 dimer and TGF-S21g_31 dimer did not affect 3H-thymidine incorporation at concentrations up to 0.8 μM.

Example 4 - TGF-θ receptor binding assay Rat muscle myoblasts (L6, American Type Culture

Collection) were plated in 6-well culture plates and cultured in DMEM supplemented with 100 units/ml penicillin, 100 μg/ml streptomycin, 2 mM L-glutamine, 10% FBS until the cells were 70-90% confluent. Medium was aspirated from the wells; and 1 ml of ice cold 20 mM glycine, 135 mM NaCl, pH 3.0 was added to each well for 2 min. The buffer was aspirated and each well was rinsed 2 times with 1 ml of DMEM, 25 mM Hepes, pH 7.4, 0.1% BSA. Samples of TGF-01 and TGF-/32 (3 to 1600 pM) and of peptides (0.1 to 30 μM) , each containing 25 pM 125I-TGF- βl or 125I-TGF-S2 were prepared in DMEM, 25 mM Hepes, pH 7.4, 0.1% BSA and added in 500 μl aliquots to the wells. Radiolabeled TGF-3 samples (500 μl) either without unlabeled TGF-/3 or with excess unlabeled TGF-S (20-25 nM) were prepared and added to other wells. After 1 hr incubation at room temperature, each well was rinsed 2 times with 1 ml of Hank's balanced saline solution, 0.1% BSA. To each well, 500 μl of 1% Triton X-100, 10% glycerol, 20 mM Hepes, pH 7.4, 0.01% BSA was added and incubated at 37°C with rotation for 30 min to lyse the cells. Samples were transferred into gamma-counting vials and counted for 1 min each. The results are presented in Table 2.

The results obtained indicate that TGF-01 competed against binding of 1 5I-TGF-01, and TGF-02 competed against binding of 125I-TGF-02 for L6 rat muscle myoblasts, as previously reported by Segarini et al., J. Biol. Chem., 262:14655-14662 (1987). From the competitive binding data, the apparent dissociation constants were estimated to be 10-30 pM for TGF-01 and 100-130 pM for TGF-02. TGF-0116.31 and TGF-0216.47 peptide monomers, and TGF-011g_47 and TGF-021g_31 peptide monomers and dimers at concentrations of up to 30 μM were found to be either inactive or weakly active in competing against the binding of 125I-TGF-01 or 125I-TGF-02. However, TGF-0216_47 dimer competed against the binding of 125I-TGF-02 with an apparent dissociation constant of approximately 3 μM. τc'F"^1i6-31 PePtiά.e dimer competed against the binding of 125I-TGF-01 with an apparent dissociation constant of 10-15 μM. Exa ple 5 - Localization of TGF-_?21C 47 peptide activity and the disulfide bonds

To localize the regions of the TGF-02,g_47 peptide responsible for biological activity, TGF-0232_47 was synthesized and compared to TGF-0216.31. TGF-02,g_31 peptide, the N-terminal half of the TGF-02lg_47 peptide, was found to be inactive in the mink lung epithelial cell and thymocyte proliferation assays and in the receptor binding assay, performed as discussed above. The dimeric form of the TGF-032_47 peptide was prepared by forming a disulfide bond at Cys44 between the two monomeric peptides.

Table 3 Competition against 1 5I-TGF-02 in binding to L6 rat muscle myoblast TGF-0 receptor

TGF-02 60 pM

TGF-023 .47 dimer not active monomer not active

As shown in Table 3, the TGF-0232.47 peptide as monomer and as dimer at concentrations up to 30 μM did not compete against the binding of 125I-TGF-02 to the L6 rat muscle myoblasts. Furthermore, as shown in Table 4, the peptide as monomer and dimer at concentrations up to 10 μM did not inhibit the proliferation of mink lung epithelial cells. Since TGF-0216_31 and TGF-0232_47 peptides were not active in these assays, the activity of the TGF-0216_47 peptide resides in the full length peptide.

The TGF-0216_47 peptide contains two cysteine residues, Cys^ and Cys44. It has been demonstrated by assaying for the reduced form of cysteine, that the two monomers are linked by a single disulfide bond, rather than two disulfide bonds involving both Cys16 and Cys44. Dimerization could thus occur by a disulfide bond between Cys16-Cys16, Cys44-Cys44, or Cys16
